sen.j: 三村竹清（みむら ちくせい、男性、明治9年（1876年）5月4日 - 昭和28年（1953年）8月26日）は、日本の書誌学者である。
sen.e: Chikusei MIMURA (male, May 4, 1876-August 26, 1953) was a bibliographer in Japan.
Chikusei MIMURA (male, May 4, 1876-August 26, 1953) was a bibliographer in Japan.
Chikusei MIMURA (male, May 4, 1876-August 26, 1953) was a bibliographer in Japan.

sen.j: 終生を市井の学者として過ごした。
sen.e: Throughout his life, he lived as a populace scholar.
Throughout his life, he lived as a populace scholar.
Throughout his life, he lived as a populace scholar.

sen.j: また篆刻に巧みであった。
sen.e: He was also good at seal carving.
He was also good at seal-engraving.
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。
sen.e: He was also good at seal-engraving.

sen.j: 本名は三村清三郎、竹問屋を営んでいたことから、竹清と号 (称号)した。
sen.e: His real name was Seizaburo MIMURA, but used 'Chikusei' for his first name, as his family ran a bamboo wholesaler.
His real name was Seizaburo MIMURA, but used 'Chikusei' for his go (pseudonym), as his family ran a bamboo wholesaler.
His real name was Seizaburo MIMURA, but used 'Chikusei' for his go (pseudonym), as his family ran a bamboo wholesaler.

sen.j: 別号に奛（あきら）・安岐羅。
sen.e: MIMURA also used 'Akira' for his first name.
MIMURA also used 'Akira' for his betsu-go (another pseudonym).
MIMURA also used 'Akira' for his betsu-go (another pseudonym).

sen.j: 東京京橋の出身。
sen.e: He was born in Kyobashi, Tokyo.
He was born in Kyobashi, Tokyo.
He was born in Kyobashi, Tokyo.

sen.j: 略伝
sen.e: Brief biography
Brief Personal History
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。
sen.e: Brief Personal History

sen.j: 小学校を中途で辞めて12歳で丁稚奉公に出る。
sen.e: MIMURA dropped out elementary school, and served an apprenticeship at the age of 12.
MIMURA dropped out elementary school, and served an apprenticeship at the age of 12.
MIMURA dropped out elementary school, and served an apprenticeship at the age of 12.

sen.j: 小遣いを溜めて『淮南子』を購入。
sen.e: He saved his allowance and purchased 'Huainanzi (The Masters/Philosophers of Huainan).'
He saved his allowance and purchased "Huainanzi (The Masters/Philosophers of Huainan)."
He saved his allowance and purchased "Huainanzi (The Masters/Philosophers of Huainan)."

sen.j: その後も本好きが高じて8年間で小舟１艘ほどの本を買い、読みあさった。
sen.e: Being a bookworm, he kept purchasing and reading books, ending up in 8 years with a volume which could fill a small boat.
Being a bookworm, he kept purchasing and reading books, ending up in 8 years with a volume which could fill a small boat.
Being a bookworm, he kept purchasing and reading books, ending up in 8 years with a volume which could fill a small boat.

sen.j: 日露戦争に看護長として従軍したときも本好きは変らず、『十三経』を行軍に持ち込み友人に背負わせて困らせている。
sen.e: When he served the Russo-Japanese War, he was such a booklover that he brought in Jusankyo (Thirteen Classics) while marching, and troubled his friends as he had them carry the books on their back.

When he served the Russo-Japanese War as a chief orderly, he was such a booklover that he brought in "Jusankyo (Thirteen Classics)" while marching, and troubled his friends as he had them carry the books on their back.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れas a chief orderlyを補足しました。" "を追加しました。
sen.e: When he served the Russo-Japanese War as a chief orderly, he was such a booklover that he brought in "Jusankyo (Thirteen Classics)" while marching, and troubled his friends as he had them carry the books on their back.

sen.j: 経書以外にも洒落本など様々な本を読んでいる。
sen.e: Other than classic Confucian writings, MIMURA read a wide variety of books including sharebon (witty books).
Other than classic Confucian writings, MIMURA read a wide variety of books including sharebon (witty books).
Other than classic Confucian writings, MIMURA read a wide variety of books including sharebon (witty books).

sen.j: すぐに下宿の本棚が溢れた。
sen.e: Those books soon overflew his boarding house.
Those books soon overflew his boarding house.
Those books soon overflew his boarding house.

sen.j: そうするうちに気付いたことなどを書き溜めたノートが20冊を超え、それを整理して書き物を始める。
sen.e: In the meantime, he started writing, using thoughts and ideas he put down in more than 20 notebooks.
In the meantime, he started writing, using thoughts and ideas he put down in more than 20 notebooks.
In the meantime, he started writing, using thoughts and ideas he put down in more than 20 notebooks.

sen.j: 一方で知識・教養を深める為に勉学を始め、経学・漢学を長坂或斎に学ぶ。
sen.e: To enrich his knowledge and education, he also started studying Keisho (important literatures in Confucianism) and Sinology (study of the Chinese classics) under 長坂或斎.
sen.cmt: 長坂或斎の名前の読みがわかりません。
sen.e: To enrich his knowledge and education, he also started studying Keisho (important literatures in Confucianism) and Sinology (study of the Chinese classics) under 長坂或斎.
To enrich his knowledge and education, he also started studying Keisho (important literatures in Confucianism) and Sinology (study of the Chinese classics) under 長坂或斎.

sen.j: また成瀬大域について書法を、池田琴峰、荒木寛畝には日本画を受け後には松本楓湖にも画を学ぶ。
sen.e: He also learned shoho (penmanship) under Daiiki NARUSE, Nihonga (Japanese-style Painting) under Kinpo Ikeda and Kanpo ARAKI, and drawing under Fuko MATSUMOTO.
He also learned shoho (penmanship) under Daiiki NARUSE, Nihonga (Japanese-style Painting) under Kinpo Ikeda and Kanpo ARAKI, and drawing under Fuko MATSUMOTO.
He also learned shoho (penmanship) under Daiiki NARUSE, Nihonga (Japanese-style Painting) under Kinpo Ikeda and Kanpo ARAKI, and drawing under Fuko MATSUMOTO.

sen.j: 篆刻は浜村蔵六に私淑した。
sen.e: On seal carving, he was deeply influenced by Zoroku HAMAMURA.
On seal-engraving, he was deeply influenced by Zoroku HAMAMURA.
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。
sen.e: On seal-engraving, he was deeply influenced by Zoroku HAMAMURA.

sen.j: こうして文人的な教養と技芸を身につけ、文芸万般に深い造詣を得た。
sen.e: Thus, MIMURA cultivated literary education and techniques, and acquired a wide and deep knowledge of literature.
Thus, MIMURA cultivated literary education and techniques, and acquired a wide and deep knowledge of literature.
Thus, MIMURA cultivated literary education and techniques, and acquired a wide and deep knowledge of literature.

sen.j: 漢詩・書・画・篆刻のみならず、和歌・狂歌・俳諧にも興じている。
sen.e: He enjoyed Chinese-style poem, paintings and calligraphic works, seal carvings as well as waka (Japanese poetry), kyoka (comic tanka poem of thirty-one syllables) and haikai (seventeen-syllable short poem).

He enjoyed Chinese-style poem, paintings and calligraphic works, seal-engravings as well as waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables), kyoka (comic tanka poem of thirty-one syllables) and haikai (seventeen-syllable short poem).
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。
sen.e: He enjoyed Chinese-style poem, paintings and calligraphic works, seal-engravings as well as waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables), kyoka (comic tanka poem of thirty-one syllables) and haikai (seventeen-syllable short poem).

sen.j: とりわけ篆刻は一家を成すほど優れていた。
sen.e: In particular, he has established a name as a seal engraving artist.
In particular, he has established a name as a seal engraving artist.
In particular, he has established a name as a seal engraving artist.

sen.j: 蔵書家の中川得楼の知遇を得て出入りを繰り返すうちに、山中共古、林若樹、内田魯庵、幸田成友、大野洒竹などとの交流が始まる。
sen.e: Taken under the wing of book collector Tokuro NAKAGAWA and visiting him frequently, MIMURA began to associate with Kyoko YAMANAKA, Wakaki HAYASHI, Roan UCHIDA, Shigetomo KODA, and Shachiku ONO.
Taken under the wing of book collector Tokuro NAKAGAWA and visiting him frequently, MIMURA began to associate with Kyoko YAMANAKA, Wakaki HAYASHI, Roan UCHIDA, Shigetomo KODA, and Shachiku ONO.
Taken under the wing of book collector Tokuro NAKAGAWA and visiting him frequently, MIMURA began to associate with Kyoko YAMANAKA, Wakaki HAYASHI, Roan UCHIDA, Shigetomo KODA, and Shachiku ONO.

sen.j: 稀書複製会（山田清作主催：大正7年創立）に第2期から加わり、以降長期にわたり、稀覯書の探索や複製に尽力する。
sen.e: MIMURA joined a group of reproducing extremely valuable books, established in 1918 and sponsored by Seisaku YAMADA, in its second phase, and made a good contribution in searching and reproducing kikosho (extremely valuable book).

MIMURA joined a group of reproducing extremely valuable books, established in 1918 and sponsored by Seisaku YAMADA, in its second phase, and made a good contribution in searching and reproducing kikosho (extremely valuable book) for a long time.
sen.cmt: for a long timeを補足しました。
sen.e: MIMURA joined a group of reproducing extremely valuable books, established in 1918 and sponsored by Seisaku YAMADA, in its second phase, and made a good contribution in searching and reproducing kikosho (extremely valuable book) for a long time.

sen.j: 米山堂主人山田清作の仲介などで、坪内逍遥や市島春城との交友も生まれる。
sen.e: Through the intercession of Beisan-do master Seisaku YAMADA, MIMURA get associated with Shoyo TSUBOUCHI and Shunjo ICHISHIMA.
Through Beisan-do master Seisaku YAMADA, MIMURA get associated with Shoyo TSUBOUCHI and Shunjo ICHISHIMA.
Through Beisan-do master Seisaku YAMADA, MIMURA get associated with Shoyo TSUBOUCHI and Shunjo ICHISHIMA.

sen.j: 大正10年に逍遥に依頼され、熱海水口村温泉の碑の題額を書している。
sen.e: At the request of Shoyo, MIMURA presented an inscription for a monument at a hot spring in Atami Minakuchi village in 1921.
At the request of Shoyo, MIMURA presented an inscription for a monument at a hot spring in Atami Minakuchi village in 1921.
At the request of Shoyo, MIMURA presented an inscription for a monument at a hot spring in Atami Minakuchi village in 1921.

sen.j: 昭和10年（1935年）、逍遥の墓碑銘の揮毫もしている。
sen.e: In 1935, MIMURA provided a writing for the epitaph on the tombstone of Shoyo.
In 1935, MIMURA also provided a writing for the epitaph on the tombstone of Shoyo.
In 1935, MIMURA also provided a writing for the epitaph on the tombstone of Shoyo.

sen.j: 古書などから得られた古人の詳細で膨大な知識を蓄え、伝記を起し始める。
sen.e: Based upon his detailed and extensive knowledge about the people of the old which he accumulated through reading of old books, MIMURA began writing biographies.
Based upon his detailed and extensive knowledge about the people of the old which he accumulated through reading of old books, MIMURA began writing biographies.
Based upon his detailed and extensive knowledge about the people of the old which he accumulated through reading of old books, MIMURA began writing biographies.

sen.j: 著名な人物はわざと避けて、歴史に埋もれしまった人物を好んで取り上げた。
sen.e: He intentionally avoided writing about famous people, and deliberately picked up those who lived rather unrecognized in the history.
He intentionally avoided writing about famous people, but deliberately picked up those who lived rather unrecognized in the history.
He intentionally avoided writing about famous people, but deliberately picked up those who lived rather unrecognized in the history.

sen.j: 掲載する雑誌も原稿料を度外視し、できるだけ目立たないものを選んでいる。
sen.e: He chose magazines as conspicuous as possible in which his biography works were carried, and he almost ignored manuscript fees.
He chose magazines as inconspicuous as possible in which his biography works were carried, and he almost ignored manuscript fees.
sen.cmt: 意味が逆だと思います。Conspicuous → inconspicuous
sen.e: He chose magazines as inconspicuous as possible in which his biography works were carried, and he almost ignored manuscript fees.

sen.j: それでもなお驚くほど膨大な著述を残している。
sen.e: Even so, MIMURA left astonishingly enormous volume of works.
Even so, MIMURA left astonishingly enormous volume of works.
Even so, MIMURA left astonishingly enormous volume of works.

sen.j: 森銑三は、三村竹清・林若樹（林研海の子）・三田村鳶魚を「江戸通の三大人」と評している。
sen.e: Senzo MORI called Chikusei MIMURA, Wakaki HAYASHI, and Engyo MITAMURA as "three great experts on Edo period."
Senzo MORI called Chikusei MIMURA, Wakaki HAYASHI (son of Kenkai HAYASHI), and Engyo MITAMURA as 'three great experts on Edo period.'
sen.cmt: (son of Kenkai HAYASHI)を追加しました。" " → ' '
sen.e: Senzo MORI called Chikusei MIMURA, Wakaki HAYASHI (son of Kenkai HAYASHI), and Engyo MITAMURA as 'three great experts on Edo period.'

sen.j: 昭和28年（1953年）夏、湯河原にて没す。
sen.e: He died in Yugawara in the summer of 1953.
He died in Yugawara in the summer of 1953.
He died in Yugawara in the summer of 1953.

sen.j: 享年79。
sen.e: He was 79 years old.
He was 79 years old.
He was 79 years old.

sen.j: 日記
sen.e: Diary
Diary
Diary

sen.j: 早稲田大学演劇博物館には竹清の日記『不秋草堂日歴』が保管されている。
sen.e: Chikusei's diary, "Fushusodo nichireki," is in custody at the TSUBOUCHI Memorial Theatre Museum of Waseda University.
sen.cmt: 「保管されている場所」の記述が抜けていたので、ウェブで確認していれました。
sen.e: Chikusei's diary, "Fushusodo nichireki," is in custody at the TSUBOUCHI Memorial Theatre Museum of Waseda University.
Chikusei's diary, "Fushusodo nichireki," is in custody at the TSUBOUCHI Memorial Theatre Museum of Waseda University.

sen.j: この日記は明治43年（1910年）から昭和28年（1953年）1月までの日々が克明に綴られ、書き損じや誤字脱字もほとんどない。
sen.e: This diary, beginning in 1910 and ending in January 1953, records his life in detail, and few mistakes in writings or ellipses and incorrect characters are found.
This diary, beginning in 1910 and ending in January 1953, records his life in detail, and few mistakes in writings or ellipses and incorrect characters are found.
This diary, beginning in 1910 and ending in January 1953, records his life in detail, and few mistakes in writings or ellipses and incorrect characters are found.

sen.j: 全145冊、原稿用紙にして1万5千枚という膨大な量の日記であるが、三村竹清日記研究会によって早稲田大学演劇博物館が発行する紀要『演劇研究』16号（1993年）から毎号に連載されている。
sen.e: The diary, consisting of an enormous 145 volumes, or an equivalent of 15,000 pages of writing manuscript, is introduced by a research society of Chikusei MIMURA diary in the bulletin "Theatre Research," published by the TSUBOUCHI Memorial Theatre Museum of Waseda University, since its volume 16, 1993.

The diary, consisting of an enormous 145 volumes, or an equivalent of 15,000 pages of writing manuscript, is introduced by a research society of Chikusei MIMURA diary in the bulletin "Theatre Research," published by the TSUBOUCHI Memorial Theatre Museum of Waseda University, since its volume 16, 1993.

The diary, consisting of an enormous 145 volumes, or an equivalent of 15,000 pages of writing manuscript, is introduced by a research society of Chikusei MIMURA diary in the bulletin "Theatre Research," published by the TSUBOUCHI Memorial Theatre Museum of Waseda University, since its volume 16, 1993.

sen.j: 著作
sen.e: Literary works
Literary works
Literary works

sen.j: 『平々凡々四十印』
sen.e: "Heihei Bonbon Shijuin"
"Heihei Bonbon Shijuin"
"Heihei Bonbon Shijuin"

sen.j: 『江戸地字集覧』岡書院、昭和4年
sen.e: "Edo Chimeiji Shuran" Oka Shoin, 1929
sen.cmt: 江戸地名字集覧 が正しいと思われます
sen.e: "Edo Chimeiji Shuran" Oka Shoin, 1929
"Edo Chimeiji Shuran" Oka Shoin, 1929

sen.j: 『本の話』昭和5年
sen.e: "Hon no Hanashi" (Tales about Books) 1930
"Hon no Hanashi" (Tales about Books) 1930
"Hon no Hanashi" (Tales about Books) 1930

sen.j: 『佳気春天（かきすて）』昭和10年
sen.e: "Kakisute" 1935
"Kakisute" 1935
"Kakisute" 1935

sen.j: 『近世能書伝』二見書房、昭和15年
sen.e: "Kinsei No Shoden" Futami Shobo, 1940
"Kinsei No Shoden" Futami Shobo, 1940
"Kinsei No Shoden" Futami Shobo, 1940

sen.j: 『三村竹清集』森銑三監修、肥田晧三・中野三敏共編、<日本書誌学体系23>青裳堂書店、昭和57年
sen.e: "Chikusei MIMURA Anthology" edited by Senzo MORI, with Kozo HIDA, Mitsutoshi NAKANO, series 23 of "Nihon Shoshi gaku Taikei" Seishodo Shoten, 1982
"Chikusei MIMURA Anthology" edited by Senzo MORI, with Kozo HIDA, Mitsutoshi NAKANO, series 23 of "Nihon Shoshi gaku Taikei" Seishodo Shoten, 1982
"Chikusei MIMURA Anthology" edited by Senzo MORI, with Kozo HIDA, Mitsutoshi NAKANO, series 23 of "Nihon Shoshi gaku Taikei" Seishodo Shoten, 1982

sen.j: 巻1 藏書印譜・ 續藏書印譜・ 藏書印譜第三集・ 新選古鑄百印・ 近世花押譜
sen.e: vol. 1 "Zosho Inpu" (Compilation of book seal marks), "Zoku Zosho Inpu", "Zosho Inpu Dai San Shu" "Shinsen Kochu Hyakuin"
vol. 1 "Zosho Inpu" (Compilation of book seal marks), "Zoku Zosho Inpu", "Zosho Inpu Dai San Shu" "Shinsen Kochu Hyakuin," "Kinsei Kaofu"
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ"Kinsei Kaofu"を補足しました。

sen.e: vol. 4 "Kinsei Nosho Den" (Stories of Skilled Calligrapher in Early-Modern Times)

vol. 5 "Inwa Injin Den" (Story of Engravers of Tenkoku)

vol. 6 "Kinsei Bunga Den"

tit.e: vol. 7 "Ise Jinbutsu Shi" (Stories of Personalities in Ise)
vol. 7 "Ise Jinbutsu Shi" (Stories of Personalities in Ise)
